reviewText: Honestly, I think the people giving positive reviews for this game have vested interest in the game or something.  Most of them sound very forced and don't give any substantial reason as to why the game is good, other than it's fun" or "the devs are nice."  The game simply isn't very good.  It just seems like a game that you'd find on any free flash game website - but far rougher around the edges.  For example
date: there's actually no end to the levels (I had to read the other negative reviews to figure this out) - when you get all the way to the right side of the level
recommended: there's just an invisible wall that prevents you from moving any further.  In the Streets of Peril level
voteText: you actually get stuck in a small area on the dirt because the game prevents you from jumping for some reason.  In the arcade levels?  You just instantly die when you go too far.  The entire game has just such low production quality - and it definitely seems like one of those "first try" game efforts that might have come out of a project course in high school.\n\nTo be frank
helpfulPercent: I don't think this game should have been released on Steam.  It would never have passed the quality controls of previous years.\n\n"

reviewText:
Not much of a game here... ...yet.
Updated 6/8/2015.
Since the game updated, I decided to play through a second time.

My points still stand from the last time I played this game.

Pros
+ Cute graphics.
+ Mostly responsive controls.
+ It launches.

Cons
- Dull and slow gameplay.
- Other troops do nothing except wander. Not even good at blocking enemy fire. (Lemmings are better at blocking damage.)
- No level progression?
- Fall through the floor randomly, killed by the hun."
- Jump on another troop member and you suddenly can't jump.
- Get to the "end" of the level and you can't jump.
- Bullets not hitting their target
date:
despite the clear line of sight and crosshair.
- Infinite spawning Nazis kaiser babies. (No Nazi Zombie Vampires? Okay.)
­­­­­­­­­­"Also the Germans (not Nazis because this is world war 1)..." -The Developer
- $1.99 for a broken game? K.

How to improve
// Get more sounds for the voices

reviewText:
So I've played a bit of the game, and I'm  surprised that this game actually gave me a good time in playing it.
It brought me back to the time when I had an Atari (when I was 4-5 years old).
There were a load of Arcade games, just like this one and I had the time of my life playing them back in the day :d.
I bought the game with a coupon 50 % off. For 50 cents, this game is great.
I see there are a lot of negative reviews. Its like when people buy a 1 euro/dollar game, they expect Skyrim, or something ?
The game answers to it's price. It is good, and I had a lot of fun playing it. :)
Good job , Dev/Devs, don't be influenced by the negative reviews, you did a fairly good job :).

reviewText: Lost Battalion is a continously improving side scroller shooting game with a really nice developer behind it who is very excited about the game and receptive to new ideas and changes. The game is getting updated 2 times a day. The developer wants to add more game modes and settings to the game and has confided to me that he will not ever charge for DLC on Lost Battalion. So you will be investing in a game that will be quickly improving from one day to the next. If you are on the fence about this game or want something to be changed, I say buy the game and friend the developer and tell him what you would like to be changed like I did. It's a cool game on its way to becoming something really special. Check it out.

reviewText:
EDITED REVIEW AFTER 6 MONTHS:

I am changing this review because the game and the developer have both shown a lot of improvement. First let me say that the developer is human and it's not an easy job. Gamers are quick to espouse their opinions and rarely offer the same degree of politeness expected in person. It can be very hard to hear harsh criticism from strangers when you have shown the bravery to share your art with the world at large and sometimes hurt feelings can lead you to make rash decisions. In this case the developer has matured and taken the criticisms to heart. He has stopped censoring opinions and put a lot of hard work into his game. It shows and it is appreciated. I now support this developer and look forward to his future work. I would also like to apologize if I offended Jake from Statefarm at any stage of the process.

WARNING: Another developer who deletes negative criticism posts and bans users for them. Avoid this game and developer at all costs. The User CashPanda and myself have both had forum posts with negative, but constructive criticism deleted as well as being banned with the following message You have been permanently banned from all The Lost Battalion: All Out Warfare discussions.
You were banned by a The Lost Battalion: All Out Warfare developer.
Reason: "Toxic behavior""  There is NO ROOM on Steam for developers like this.

I am having trouble recommending this game for any reason. I am a huge supporter of indie games and can usually find a redeeming idea or element of execution
date: but here I have no hope. The whole game is less functional and rewarding than ANY game you will find on the free flash game websites like Armor Games
recommended: etc. This game is merely a series of static screens consisting of one length scroll right
hoursPlayed: one left with endless waves of stupid enemies that come along. There is no point other than try to beat your score. As if that wasn't bad enough
voteText: it's wonky and unpredictable. Jump up and down a few times and you will randomly ending up in "the mud" and instantly die. Walk to the right and you might end up in the mud and instantly die. It's incredibly bad at this point and while I do believe in cutting low priced games some slack
helpfulPercent: I would tell my friends to stay away even if it was free. This is a course in how NOT to develop games. This team seems to have failed to develop a concept or design document even though they have been working on this for "8 months". I do not have any interest in being mean or hurting the feelings of this team but this type of production has no place on Steam. It is damaging to the overall quality of the platform when an aimless team sells something that an average newcomer could make himself in 5-7 days with Game Maker. Developer
votesHelpful: please consider taking your game down from the store until you have a concept. This is in response to the only post on the forum at this time which is from you asking us from gameplay ideas. This is NOT how to make games. I wish you better luck in the future
votesTotal: please study our industry a bit and learn the steps to making a game that is going to be enjoyed and appreciated by others if not a commercial success."

reviewText:
Product received for free

A guy on reddit gave this to me for free for my borthday. Its arcadey. Kind of hard because you get swarmed but whatever. It is pretty fun, i'd reccomend getting it on sale however. Sometimes shots feel like they should have hit, and enemies bullets go through cover and trenches. I feel that eother changing the spawn rate, or making it so cover and such does something could make this game a lot better.

That being said, for the price (I believe it said $1 canadian), it isnt bad, and is actually quite funny, and well made.
